name: places/ChIJRWhPlORYwokRJGTJMBtHH2M
formattedAddress: 150 E 55th St 5th floor, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 150 E 55th St 5th floor, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: I called to get more information on the services you offer and received a call back today. The woman I spoke with, Sabrina (?), was completely unethical. Before getting any personal information from me, she exclaimed that endometriosis is a life-long illness that can only be treated through extraction surgery and life-long diet, and that if it's not treated, it can turn to cancer. She then asked me what my CA-125 level was and what stage of endometriosis I have. Again, before offering any information about how your office works. This is a very hard and emotional disease to deal with and to be bombarded with comments like this is highly unprofessional. I did not make an appointment, and wouldn't have even if I still wanted to, as they do not take in-network insurance.

originalText.text: Two day’s post op & inflammation (that I’ve had in my face for months) has started to go down already! I have gone to every specialist imaginable (looking for answers/reasons for my inflammatory markers to be sky high) , knowing I have endometriosis, not realizing it was causing so much information throughout my body. I am incredibly grateful for other’s sharing this true specialists information & excited for my second chance at life again! I can not thank him enough!

originalText.text: Dr. Kanayama and his staff are the most respectful and empathetic group of people that you can work with while dealing with this disease. If you are able to see him in New York City, I 100% recommend you trust Dr. Kanayama with your endometriosis treatment. Dr. Kanayama takes the time to listen to your concerns, and is wonderful at giving you clear guidance as you navigate your endometriosis.

originalText.text: Dr Kanayama has saved my life. I saw many doctors before him - I had been misdiagnosed and dismissed by all of them. I had debilitating pelvic and lower back pain and I felt like I was never going to get my life back. Dr Kanayama was the first doctor to truly listen to me. I felt heard for the first time in years. He diagnosed my endometriosis and then performed laparoscopic surgery to remove the stage 3.5 endo. The entire experience was the best that a surgery could possibly be. I felt safe, secure, and so well taken care of, before and after surgery. He gave me hope and asked me to believe in him and myself. He is kind, respectful, and empathetic. He is the best doctor I have ever seen - he is truly working every day to relieve the suffering of women with this extremely complicated and misunderstood disease. after just a few months, my pain has improved and I have my life back. I cannot thank him enough for the high quality care and respectful treatment. Sabrina is responsible for insurance and is also amazing. She is super available and I felt sure that she would fight for me if any issue came up with my insurance. The whole team at the NY Endometriosis Center is empathetic and caring. I am so grateful to have found them and count myself as extremely lucky to have been treated by Dr K, his understanding of endo and surgical skills are miraculous. I also really love the Instagram account for the office, I feel connected and supported by Dr K’s outreach to women with endometriosis. I would highly recommend Dr Kanayama to any woman with endo or suspicions of endo. He will listen and be honest - a rare combination in the complex world of women’s health! Thank you Dr Kanayama!!

originalText.text:
My wife and I felt like there was no hope left for remediation of pain from what we thought was endometriosis. Everywhere we went, every OB we saw said the same things: "it's just your body" "Manage it with birth control and pain meds" "even if it is endometriosis - it's incurable, nothing can be done."

Dr. Kanayama was the first doctor who truly listened to our story and showed real compassion for the pain that my wife has been experiencing every day. He informed us that, though not 100% curable, there are ways to treat/remediate endo and that his technique's success is so good that there is only a small chance of endo recurring for Kelcie.

Today, my wife had successful excision surgery, completely removing the endometrial tissue that had been building up for over a decade. The endometriosis had pulled her uterus 45 degrees to the side, crushing her right ovary and started creating pockets of toxic blood deposits that were slowly poisoning her causing migraines, acne and a host of other issues.

Truthfully, she's in pain right now, but we've been in and out of tears all day because, for the first time since we got married, we have hope that her quality of life can be so much more than it has been.

Thank you Dr. Kanayama for caring enough to listen to women who struggle with endo. Your procedure doesn't just change lives, it saves them. I plan to update this review a few months post op to confirm the difference that we already know there will be.

If you think you have endometriosis, you owe it to yourself to see Dr. Masahide Kanayama - he will listen and he will help you.
